availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Redick O'Bryan and Elizabeth O'Bryan. Married to Louisa J. O'Bryan. Father of Mary F. O'Bryan, E. J. O'Bryan, William A. O'Bryan, James L. O'Bryan, Martha O'Bryan, and Sarah O'Bryan. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 61A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 711.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Seminary, p. 136A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, July 1863, p. 31 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
"Rev John L. O'Bryan (1828-1913)," Find A Grave, Memorial #60782372, accessed October 20, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60782372.
